title: Fort Scott National Historic Site: Education
body: Fort Scott: Lessons from an Adolescent America Fort Scott National Historic Site invites you to step back in time to experience life at a frontier army post and to participate in the events of a town immersed in conflict! We invite you to participate in one of our curriculum based education programs or one of our other educational opportunities.                 Every Kid in a Park Fort Scott NHS will  pay for the transportation costs of fourth grade school groups coming to the park.   Learn more about Every Kid in a Park. Read More        Life on the Frontier Reservations are now being taken for Life on the Frontier, a school program for K-4 studets.  Offered May 5 and 6, 2016. Read More        Sweep Through History Reservations are now being taken for Sweep Through History, a school program for students in grades 4-8.  Offered on selected days in April and May. Read More        Virtual Resource Center The virtual resource center is a research aid to students and volunteers preparing education and living history programs about 1840s frontier life. Read More         Plan A Field Trip
